uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.text

Interface Localizer


  • public interface Localizer
    This interface represents a simple but powerful system for internationalisation. Instances of this class provide automatic implementations of sub-interfaces of LocalizedText according to a Locale setting, which delegate method invocations to be fetched from resource bundles.

      • getLocalization

        <T extends LocalizedText<T>> T getLocalization(Class<T> accessor,
                                               LocalizedResourceBundle bundle)
        Generate an implementing instance of the given accessor interface class, according to the rules described by LocalizedText, and with resource values taken from the given resource bundle.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the localisation text accessor interface
        Parameters:
        accessor - the sub-interface of LocalizedText we wish to implement
        bundle - the resource bundle with which to load resources
        Returns:
        an implementation of the accessor interface

      • getLocalization

        default <T extends LocalizedText<T>> T getLocalization(Class<T> accessor,
                                                       ClassLoader classLoader,
                                                       String... locations)
        Generate an implementing instance of the given accessor interface class, according to the rules described by LocalizedText. Resources are loading according to the LocalizedResourceBundle returned from LocalizedResourceBundle.getBundle(ClassLoader, Locale, String[]) invoked with the given class loader and locations, and the current locale.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the localisation text accessor interface
        Parameters:
        accessor - the sub-interface of LocalizedText we wish to implement
        classLoader - the class loader to fetch resource bundles from
        locations - the base names of all backing resource bundles
        Returns:
        an implementation of the accessor interface

      • getLocalization

        default <T extends LocalizedText<T>> T getLocalization(Class<T> accessor,
                                                       String... locations)
        Generate an implementing instance of the given accessor interface class, according to the rules described by LocalizedText. Resources are loading according to the LocalizedResourceBundle returned from LocalizedResourceBundle.getBundle(ClassLoader, Locale, String[]) invoked with the class loader of the given class, and the given locations.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the localisation text accessor interface
        Parameters:
        accessor - the sub-interface of LocalizedText we wish to implement
        locations - the base names of all backing resource bundles
        Returns:
        an implementation of the accessor interface

      • getLocalization

        default <T extends LocalizedText<T>> T getLocalization(Class<T> accessor)
        Generate an implementing instance of the given accessor interface class, according to the rules described by LocalizedText. Resources are loading according to the LocalizedResourceBundle returned from LocalizedResourceBundle.getBundle(ClassLoader, Locale, String[]) invoked with the class loader of the given class, and the location derived by taking the given class name, and removing Text from the end if it is present.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the localisation text accessor interface
        Parameters:
        accessor - the sub-interface of LocalizedText we wish to implement
        Returns:
        an implementation of the accessor interface

      • getKey

        static String getKey(Method method,
                     Object... arguments)
        The default translation scheme to generate resource keys from methods.

        The class name and method name are split into words according to camel-case rules and put into lower-case, then the word "text" is removed from the end of the class name if present, then each word from the class and each word from the method are joined in order about the "." character.

        For example the method LocalizerText.illegalReturnType(Class, java.lang.reflect.Method) would generate the key "localizer.illegal.return.type". The key generation rules can be overridden for a given method by annotating with LocalizationKey.

        Parameters:
        method - the method for which we wish to determine an associated resource key
        arguments - the invocation arguments, which may contribute to the key as per AppendToLocalizationKey
        Returns:
        the default resource key for the given method

      • getDefaultLocalizer

        static Localizer getDefaultLocalizer()
        Get a simple Localizer implementation over the system locale.
        Returns:
        a Localizer for the system locale

      • getLocalizer

        static Localizer getLocalizer(LocaleProvider provider)
        Get a simple Localizer implementation over the given locale provider.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a Localizer for the given locale

      • getLocalizer

        static Localizer getLocalizer(LocaleProvider provider,
                              Log log)
        Get a simple Localizer implementation over the given locale provider.
        Parameters:
        provider - a provider to establish a locale setting
        log - a log for localisation information
        Returns:
        a Localizer for the given locale
